name: Helen Keller International
mission: Guided by our founder’s remarkable legacy, Helen Keller Intl works to improve the lives of people around the world by protecting vision, enhancing nutri...
theoryOfChange: Helen Keller International utilizes the 'Essential Nutrition Actions (ENA) framework' as an organizing framework for its strategy to improve maternal, infant, and young child nutrition. This framework provides an operational approach for advocacy, planning, training, and delivery of an integrated package of interventions designed to achieve public health impact. Additionally, their broader organizational strategy, 'Leading Locally, Fortifying Futures,' outlines their approach to sustaining core program areas of nutrition, vision, and health, and driving transformation in high-impact areas. The organization also emphasizes 'Rigor' as a core value, combining research, evidence, and on-the-ground experience to achieve large-scale and long-term impact.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Helen Keller International shows strong alignment and good impact.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: http://helenkellerintl.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/FY23_HKI-Financial-Statements-FINAL.pdf)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 99.5/100 score and holds 18.6 months of working capital.
The organization maintains a program expense ratio of 82.8%.
Financial statements confirm the organization's ongoing operational stability and asset management.
Total revenue for the period was $145,494,796.
The organization provides various methods for general charitable giving and sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its near-perfect financial health score and its focus on high-urgency global health issues.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary for specific systemic interventions
Opportunity to further diversify direct impact metrics beyond systemic change

dimension_explanations.alignment: Helen Keller International shows high alignment for donors interested in global health and sadaqah-eligible giving [8]. Its long-standing track record in saving sight and enhancing nutrition addresses urgent global needs, supported by a stable financial foundation of 18.6 months of working capital [1][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on systemic change within global health, maintaining a high Charity Navigator score of 99.5/100 [1]. While the cost per beneficiary is calculated at approximately $2,063.76 for its broader systemic work, the charity effectively manages a program expense ratio of 82.8%, ensuring the vast majority of its $145,494,796 revenue reaches its programs [2][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International honors its founder's legacy by delivering life-changing vision and nutrition programs to vulnerable populations worldwide.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 82.8%
Exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.03 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 18.6 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Founded to combat the causes and consequences of blindness and malnutrition, Helen Keller International operates large-scale health care programs and vision screenings across the globe [1][2]. The organization reported a total revenue of $145,494,796, reflecting a significant capacity to implement systemic health interventions [7].

all_citations.claim: Africa, Asia, and the United States
all_citations.quote: Areas Served: Africa, Asia, United States

all_citations.claim: Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid

all_citations.quote: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its near-perfect financial health score and its focus on high-urgency global health issues.

areas_for_improvement.context: The average cost of <cite id="20">$2,063.76 per beneficiary</cite> reflects the complexity of systemic health interventions but is high compared to direct-aid peers.
With <cite id="15">18.6 months of operating reserves</cite>, the charity could improve transparency by publishing specific triggers for the planned deployment of these funds.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization mitigates this by focusing on long-term, sustainable health infrastructure rather than just temporary relief.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="20">high cost per beneficiary</cite> associated with systemic change models compared to direct service delivery.

confidence.notes: Extremely high data availability across all major rating platforms.

known_gaps: High cost per beneficiary requires more granular program-level breakdown

alignment.explanation: High alignment for Muslim donors due to extensive operations in <cite id="11">Muslim-majority countries</cite> and a focus on <cite id="10">alleviating extreme poverty</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="21">111-year track record</cite>, <cite id="9">Platinum Candid Seal</cite>, and <cite id="14">full accreditation from the BBB Wise Giving Alliance</cite>.

impact.explanation: The organization demonstrates impact through <cite id="22">$120 million in donated medicine distribution</cite> and a <cite id="6">82.8% program expense ratio</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement could be enhanced by <cite id="23">expanding services to underserved geographies</cite> with limited existing nonprofit coverage.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes with 9 metrics tracked

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Funds universities and international partners for health research and delivery

rich_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International honors its founder's legacy by delivering life-changing vision and nutrition programs to vulnerable populations worldwide.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term systemic health solutions and want to support a century-old institution with elite transparency ratings.
donor_motivations: Want to support sustainable health infrastructure in Africa and Asia
Value high-efficiency fundraising ($0.03 cost per dollar)
Prefer organizations with a Platinum Candid Seal and BBB accreditation
Interested in large-scale nutrition and vision programs
giving_considerations: Focus is on systemic change which has a higher cost-per-beneficiary than simple aid
Organization has very high reserves (18+ months)
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors specifically looking to fulfill their annual zakat obligation or those seeking low-cost, high-volume direct aid like meal programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The charity tracks <cite id="19">9 outcome metrics</cite> and has <cite id="25">documented its theory of change</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Helen Keller International uses a systemic change model to improve health and nutrition by <cite id="4">distributing essential vitamins</cite> and <cite id="5">improving food security</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale health interventions actually result in reduced blindness and improved nutrition.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While revenue is growing at <cite id="3">27.7% annually</cite>, the charity holds <cite id="15">18.6 months of working capital</cite>.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an <cite id="24">82.8% program ratio</cite> which is higher than the <cite id="12">85.2% peer median</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on healthcare direct service
similar_organizations.name: Syrian American Medical Society Foundation

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focus on pediatric healthcare in crisis zones
similar_organizations.name: Palestine Childrens Relief Fund

strengths.detail: The charity directs <cite id="6">82.8% of its total expenses</cite> toward its programs, significantly exceeding the <cite id="12">peer program ratio median of 85.2%</cite>.
The organization maintains a <cite id="13">100% independent board of 31 members</cite> and meets all <cite id="14">20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards</cite>.
The charity holds <cite id="15">18.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant financial stability for long-term health interventions.

strengths_deep_dive: Helen Keller International's operational scale is supported by a massive <cite id="16">$25,088,380 in total grants</cite> distributed to partners, with <cite id="17">$23,400,456 directed to 301 foreign recipients</cite>. This grantmaking capacity allows them to implement systemic change across <cite id="18">multiple continents</cite>. Their commitment to transparency is further evidenced by <cite id="19">tracking 9 distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid, ensuring that their impact on vision and nutrition is measurable and documented over time.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1915 to combat the causes and consequences of blindness and malnutrition, Helen Keller International operates large-scale health care programs across <cite id="1">Africa, Asia, and the United States</cite>. The organization has demonstrated remarkable growth, reporting <cite id="2">$145,494,796 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year, representing a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 27.7%</cite>. Their work focuses on systemic health interventions, including <cite id="4">distributing Vitamin A</cite>, eliminating diseases of poverty, and <cite id="5">growing better food</cite> to enhance nutrition. The charity maintains a high level of financial efficiency, with a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 82.8%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of funds directly support its mission. Furthermore, the organization is highly effective at fundraising, spending only <cite id="7">$0.03 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions. Helen Keller International is recognized for its transparency and accountability, holding a <cite id="8">99.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
